title: 108_hr1276
content: The "American Dream Downpayment Act" is also known as the Downpayment Assistance Initiative under the HOME Program, amending the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act to provide downpayment assistance. The Secretary may grant assistance to low-income families for homeownership through downpayment assistance for single-family housing. Eligible families include low-income first-time homebuyers or those with uniformed employees or teachers from the participating jurisdiction. The Secretary provides downpayment assistance to low-income families for homeownership, including first-time homebuyers, uniformed employees, and teachers from the participating jurisdiction. Eligible individuals must have income not exceeding 115-150% of the median income of the area. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a participating jurisdiction must include in its housing affordability strategy a plan for targeted outreach to residents of public housing, trailer parks, and manufactured housing for downpayment assistance. The Secretary shall allocate grant amounts for downpayment assistance to participating jurisdictions based on their need and prior commitment to assisting homebuyers, considering various funding sources. The Secretary allocates grant amounts for downpayment assistance to participating jurisdictions based on need and prior commitment to assisting homebuyers. If allocated amounts become available for reallocation, they will be redistributed according to a formula established by the Secretary. Grants under this section are generally not subject to the provisions of this title. Grants allocated for downpayment assistance to participating jurisdictions may be reallocated to the State if necessary. Grants under this section are generally exempt from certain provisions of the title, but are subject to specific requirements and references outlined in the legislation. Subtitle F of title II of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act allows for grants to be allocated for downpayment assistance to participating jurisdictions, with the possibility of reallocation to the State if needed. These grants are exempt from certain provisions of the title but are subject to specific requirements and references outlined in the legislation. Additionally, funds under subtitle A can be used for administrative and planning costs, with an authorization of $200,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2004 and 2005. The Uniform Relocation Assistance and Real Property Acquisition Policies Act of 1970 does not apply to downpayment assistance under this title.
